intro: Cailliella, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. These plants are characterized by their thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. Cailliella species are typically herbaceous and grow in a range of habitats, including grasslands and rocky areas. They are popular as ornamental plants due to their vibrant blooms and ease of cultivation. The genus includes several species, with Cailliella bicolor and Cailliella eriocarpa being among the most commonly cultivated.
